articles.title: We are still trying to understand how dangerous Wuhan coronavirus is
articles.description: For those of us who turn to science for answers, our lack of knowledge about the Wuhan coronavirus is unsettling, but it doesn't mean we are helpless to fight it
articles.content:
Xinhua/Li An
FOR those of us who turn to science for answers, the Wuhan coronavirus outbreak is unsettling. We don’t know what proportion of infected people are likely to die (see The three things we really need to know about the Wuhan coronavirus); our figu… [+2215 chars]

articles.author: Michael Le Page
articles.title: Coronavirus: Why infections from animals are such a deadly problem
articles.description: The Wuhan coronavirus is the latest example of an infection that jumped from animals into humans – and when infections do this, they can be particularly deadly

articles.author: Debora MacKenzie
articles.title: The three things we really need to know about the Wuhan coronavirus
articles.description: We still don't know the death rate, the number of cases or how easily the Wuhan coronavirus spreads, making it difficult to predict how the outbreak will pan out

articles.author: Debora MacKenzie
articles.title: Will the coronavirus become a pandemic - and what happens if it does?
articles.description: The Wuhan coronavirus has exploded in China. There are three likely scenarios for what will happen next – and the bad news is that a pandemic looks difficult to avoid
articles.content:
By Debora MacKenzie
A 2,000-bed mobile hospital is set up in an exhibition centre in Wuhan, China
eature China/Barcroft Media via Getty Images

articles.author: Donna Lu
articles.title: What life is like in Wuhan during the coronavirus lockdown
articles.description: Deserted streets, lines at pharmacies and overwhelmed hospitals – what life is like at the heart of China’s coronavirus epidemic
